verses.text: Then Joshua called the Reubenites , and the Gadites , and the half tribe of Manasseh ,
And said unto them, Ye have kept all that Moses the servant of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* commanded you, and have obeyed my voice in all that I commanded you:
Ye have not left your brethren these many days unto this day , but have kept the charge of the commandment of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God.

And now the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* your God hath given rest unto your brethren , as he promised them: therefore now return ye, and get you unto your tents , \add and\add* unto the land of your possession , which Moses the servant of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* gave you on the other side Jordan.

But take diligent heed to do the commandment and the law , which Moses the servant of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* charged you, to love the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* your God , and to walk in all his ways , and to keep his commandments , and to cleave unto him, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.
So Joshua blessed them, and sent them away : and they went unto their tents. \p

¶ Now to the \add one\add* half of the tribe of Manasseh Moses had given \add possession\add* in Bashan : but unto the \add other\add* half thereof gave Joshua among their brethren on this side Jordan westward. And when Joshua sent them away also unto their tents , then he blessed them,

And he spake unto them, saying , Return with much riches unto your tents , and with very much cattle , with silver , and with gold , and with brass , and with iron , and with very much raiment : divide the spoil of your enemies with your brethren. \p

¶ And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh returned , and departed from the children of Israel out of Shiloh , which \add is\add* in the land of Canaan , to go unto the country of Gilead , to the land of their possession , whereof they were possessed , according to the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* by the hand of Moses. \p

¶ And when they came unto the borders of Jordan , that \add are\add* in the land of Canaan , the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh built there an altar by Jordan , a great altar to see to. \p

¶ And the children of Israel heard say , Behold, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh have built an altar over against the land of Canaan , in the borders of Jordan , at the passage of the children of Israel.
And when the children of Israel heard \add of it\add*, the whole congregation of the children of Israel gathered themselves together at Shiloh , to go up to war against them.
And the children of Israel sent unto the children of Reuben , and to the children of Gad , and to the half tribe of Manasseh , into the land of Gilead , Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest ,

And with him ten princes , of each chief house a prince throughout all the tribes of Israel ; and each one \add was\add* an head of the house of their fathers among the thousands of Israel.\f + \fr 22.14 \ft chief…: Heb. house of the father\f* \p
¶ And they came unto the children of Reuben , and to the children of Gad , and to the half tribe of Manasseh , unto the land of Gilead , and they spake with them, saying ,

Thus saith the whole congregation of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, What trespass \add is\add* this that ye have committed against the God of Israel , to turn away this day from following the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, in that ye have builded you an altar , that ye might rebel this day against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*?
\add Is\add* the iniquity of Peor too little for us, from which we are not cleansed until this day , although there was a plague in the congregation of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*,

But that ye must turn away this day from following the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*? and it will be, \add seeing\add* ye rebel to day against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, that to morrow he will be wroth with the whole congregation of Israel.

Notwithstanding , if the land of your possession \add be\add* unclean , \add then\add* pass ye over unto the land of the possession of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, wherein the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* tabernacle dwelleth , and take possession among us: but rebel not against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, nor rebel against us, in building you an altar beside the altar of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* our God.
Did not Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in the accursed thing , and wrath fell on all the congregation of Israel ? and that man perished not alone in his iniquity. \p
¶ Then the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh answered , and said unto the heads of the thousands of Israel ,

The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of gods , the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of gods , he knoweth , and Israel he shall know ; if \add it be\add* in rebellion , or if in transgression against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, ( save us not this day ,)

That we have built us an altar to turn from following the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, or if to offer thereon burnt offering or meat offering , or if to offer peace offerings thereon, let the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* himself require \add it;\add*

And if we have not \add rather\add* done it for fear of \add this\add* thing , saying , In time to come your children might speak unto our children , saying , What have ye to do with the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel ?\f + \fr 22.24 \ft In time…: Heb. To morrow\f*

For the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath made Jordan a border between us and you, ye children of Reuben and children of Gad ; ye have no part in the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: so shall your children make our children cease from fearing the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
Therefore we said , Let us now prepare to build us an altar , not for burnt offering , nor for sacrifice :

But \add that\add* it \add may be\add* a witness between us, and you, and our generations after us, that we might do the service of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* before him with our burnt offerings , and with our sacrifices , and with our peace offerings ; that your children may not say to our children in time to come , Ye have no part in the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

Therefore said we, that it shall be, when they should \add so\add* say to us or to our generations in time to come , that we may say \add again\add*, Behold the pattern of the altar of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, which our fathers made , not for burnt offerings , nor for sacrifices ; but it \add is\add* a witness between us and you.

God forbid that we should rebel against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and turn this day from following the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to build an altar for burnt offerings , for meat offerings , or for sacrifices , beside the altar of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* our God that \add is\add* before his tabernacle. \p

¶ And when Phinehas the priest , and the princes of the congregation and heads of the thousands of Israel which \add were\add* with him, heard the words that the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh spake , it pleased them.\f + \fr 22.30 \ft pleased…: Heb. was good in their eyes\f*

And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest said unto the children of Reuben , and to the children of Gad , and to the children of Manasseh , This day we perceive that the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add is\add* among us, because ye have not committed this trespass against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: now ye have delivered the children of Israel out of the hand of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 22.31  t now: Heb. then * \p

¶ And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest , and the princes , returned from the children of Reuben , and from the children of Gad , out of the land of Gilead , unto the land of Canaan , to the children of Israel , and brought them word again.

And the thing pleased the children of Israel ; and the children of Israel blessed God , and did not intend to go up against them in battle , to destroy the land wherein the children of Reuben and Gad dwelt.

And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad called the altar \add Ed:\add* for it \add shall be\add* a witness between us that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* God.\f + \fr 22.34 \ft Ed: that is, A witness\f*
